explanation: The claim is not clearly correct. MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 encourages use of const for pointer-to-object parameters that are not modified, but it applies “whenever possible.” In this function sg_in is indeed not modified locally, but it is immediately forwarded to the driver callback ldev->ldrv->dev_dma_map. That callback is part of the existing driver API and (from the shown usage) expects a non-const struct metal_sg *; therefore you cannot change only this wrapper to take a const struct metal_sg * without a wider API change or an unsafe cast. Given the current API surface, marking sg_in const is not possible without breaking compatibility. Thus there is no definite, local violation of Rule 8.13 in this function as written — changing it would require coordinated changes to the driver callback signatures.
